indicators.justification:
The National Greenhouse Gas Inventory (INGEI) is submitted to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change and is in accordance with the Framework Law on Climate Change, Law No. 30754 (1) and Supreme Decree No. 013-2014-MINAM (2). The national inventories (3) have been produced in several editions, the latest edition with information from 2016, and also on the INGEI website there is a report in pdf (4) and information in excel that indicates by sectors which have been the largest emissions.

Currently there is a normative document (1) that indicates the categorisation of endangered species of fauna and the classification of species of wild flora (2), the information on endangered species and ecosystems is summarised in a report (3), and is updated to 2020. indicators.justification:
The information of civil registries and vital statistics such as births, marriages and deaths (1) of the National Registry of Identification and Civil Status (RENIEC) is available with annual or quarterly and updated information, as well as some sources of information present historical sources and can be downloaded in xls. On the other hand, there is a source of information from the Repositorio Único Nacional de Información de Salud (2) that has information that can be viewed in html with information on births such as condition of birth, characteristics of the birth, characteristics of the mother. In 2019, the National Institute of Statistics and Informatics (INEI) published a document Peru: Natalidad, Mortalidad y nupcialidad 2019 (3) which is the latest version of the report with registered births, registered deaths, marriages and divorces, complementary information for the analysis of this section.

(2)https://www.minsa.gob.pe/reunis/

indicators.justification:
In terms of the real-time capacity of the health system, the Ministry of Health has responded in a timely manner to provide information on different aspects related to covid 19, with information being updated on a daily basis. For this reason, a covid 19 page was implemented, which describes the covid 19 situation (1) and presents various items such as the progress of vaccination against covid 19 (2), number of positive cases, hospitalised cases, availability of ICU beds, deaths in real time, which can be downloaded in xls and is available in html. The National Superintendence of Health also presents reports on oxygen availability (3) and bed registry monitoring (4), which can be downloaded in PDF format. On the other hand, there is an open data page (5) with datasets on deaths, positive cases, distribution of personal protective equipment that can be downloaded in xls, csv formats.

Translated with www.DeepL.com/Translator (free version)
Sources: 

(1) https://covid19.minsa.gob.pe/sala_situacional.asp
(2) https://www.minsa.gob.pe/reunis/data/vacunas-covid19.asp
(3) http://portal.susalud.gob.pe/reporte-disponibilidad-oxigeno/
(4)http://portal.susalud.gob.pe/seguimiento-del-registro-de-camas-f500-2/
(5)https://www.datosabiertos.gob.pe/group/datos-abiertos-de-covid-19

indicators.justification:
Peru currently has a law N° 30225, the Law on State Contracting, which has been amended as evidenced in the Single Orderly Text of the Law (1). Data on contracting processes are available on the open data portal of the State Contracting Supervisory Body OSCE (2), where information on the Annual Contracting Plan, members of the selection committee, information on the call or invitation, list of bidders, contracts, award data, purchase orders and/or services, and pronouncements on any process can be found. Likewise, the information on this portal is available from 2018 to the present. This data is open access, as it can be downloaded in xls format or in html format. 
However, it is also possible to search for detailed procurement processes through the OSCE's "public search engine" portal (3), provided that information is available on who provides the good or service and the specific work (4), which can be downloaded in excel and the process itself can be viewed (5); the search for purchases with the state on the Peru Compras portal (6). In the case of works, the search can be done quickly in INFOBRAS (7)and through the investment tracking system SSI (8), where there is a section on procurement with the state. All this information can also be downloaded in xls format and through the html format.

indicators.justification:
Currently the country has a comprehensive framework for the protection of personal data that was approved in 2011, the so-called Law No. 29733 (1), which aims to guarantee the fundamental right to the protection of personal data, provided for in the Political Constitution of Peru, which is currently in force and in turn has a regulation of law (2) that provides for its mandatory compliance in all public and private entities. Likewise, it is stipulated that the Ministry of Justice and Human Rights is the National Authority for the Protection of Personal Data (3), which must comply with and enforce compliance with the regulations in force on the protection of personal data. indicators.justification:
Regarding data collection in official languages, in Peru data is currently available in Spanish, and according to Article 48 of the Peruvian Constitution, the official languages are Spanish and, in areas where they predominate, Quechua, Aymara and other aboriginal languages, Quechua, Aymara and other aboriginal languages are also official languages, according to the law (1). However, there is a regulation that involves native languages, such as the Supreme Decree N° 005-2017-MC that approves the National Policy of Native Languages, Oral Tradition and Interculturality (2) According to the Law that regulates the use, preservation, development, recovery, promotion and dissemination of the native languages of Peru(3), article 20: Mechanisms of consultation and citizen participation and paragraph 20. 2, all peasant or native communities have the right to request that the agreements, conventions and all information or documentation that they are given, distributed or must sign be in Spanish and in their native language, whenever feasible.
